metadata.title: CVE-2022-1734 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw in Linux Kernel found in nfcmrvl_nci_unregister_dev() indrivers/nfc/nfcmrvl/main.c can lead to use after free both read or writewhen non synchronized between cleanup routine and firmware downloadroutine.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-124-generic - 5.4.0-124.140
linux-image-5.4.0-124-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-124.140
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-124-generic - 5.4.0-124.140
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-124-lowlatency - 5.4.0-124.140
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1073-kvm - 5.4.0-1073.78
No subscription required
